question: The members of phaeophyceae are commonly known as ______ algae.
Brown algae are found primarily in ______ habitats.
Brown algae show great variation in size and ______.

Profusely branched brown algae include ______.

The pigment fucoxanthin is a type of ______.
The colour of brown algae depends on the amount of ______ pigment present.
In brown algae, food is stored as complex ______.
Stored food in brown algae may be in the form of laminarin or ______.
The vegetative cells of brown algae have a ______ wall.
The outer surface of brown algae is usually covered by a gelatinous coating of ______.
The protoplast of brown algae contains plastids, vacuole and ______.
In brown algae, the vacuole is centrally located in the ______.
The plant body is usually attached to the substratum by a ______.
The stalk of brown algae is called the ______.

The zoospores of brown algae have two unequal, ______ attached flagella.
Sexual reproduction in brown algae may be isogamous, anisogamous or ______.

In oogamous species, fertilisation may take place within the ______.

Gametes of brown algae have two laterally attached ______.

Dictyota is an example of a ______ alga.
Laminaria is a brown alga used as a source of ______.

In brown algae, the frond functions as a ______ organ.
The stalk connecting holdfast and frond in brown algae is called ______.
The zoospores of brown algae are biflagellate and have ______ flagella.
Gametes in brown algae may fuse in water or within the ______ in oogamous species.
Brown algae have pigments including chlorophyll a, chlorophyll c, carotenoids and ______.
The cell wall of brown algae is made of cellulose and coated externally with ______.
Fucus is a commonly found member of ______ algae.
The members of rhodophyceae are commonly called ______ algae.
Red algae are red because of the pigment ______.

Majority of the red algae are ______ in habitat.
Greater concentrations of red algae are found in the ______ areas.

Red algae can occur at great depths in ______.
Red algae can survive where relatively little ______ penetrates.
The red thalli of most red algae are ______.
Some red algae have complex ______ organisation.
In red algae, food is stored as ______ starch.
Floridean starch is structurally similar to amylopectin and ______.
Red algae usually reproduce vegetatively by ______.
Asexual reproduction in red algae occurs by ______ spores.
Sexual reproduction in red algae is also by ______ gametes.
Sexual reproduction in red algae is ______ in type.

Common members of rhodophyceae include Polysiphonia, ______, Gracilaria and Gelidium.
Floridean starch is the stored food in ______ algae.
Red algae reproduce sexually through ______ gametes.
Red algae reproduce asexually by producing ______ spores.
Red algae can survive at great ocean depths where little ______ reaches.

Some red algae show ______ body organisation.

The red pigment responsible for the colour in red algae is ______.
